title: Solve a linear system
prompt:
In order to solve this system using the substitution method, what will be the first step?
<math>
 <mrow>
  <mrow><mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign='left'>
   <mtr>
    <mtd>
     <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn>
    </mtd>
   </mtr>
   <mtr>
    <mtd>
     <mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn>
    </mtd>
   </mtr>
  </mtable>
   </mrow>
 </mrow>
</math>
hint: In the substitution method, you want to make a substitution into one equation for one of the variables.
feedback: In order to solve the system of equations by substitution, the first step is to solve one of the equations for one variable, either x or y.
